channel.title: Get started :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Get started Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Get Started section presents the most common tasks a developer will need to know how to do as they develop solutions integrated with Okta. It also gives the new developer an opportunity to get some samples up and running. About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Experienced IAM developer

item.title: Get an Okta account
item.description: Get an Okta account Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: Starts with an overview of different SKUs. Describes how to set up your Okta org for different scenarios. Developer Edition is the default, but note what is not included, how to add them, and what it costs to include them or the different SKUs required.

item.title: Set up your org
item.description: Set up your org Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: Describes how to set up your Okta org for different scenarios. This doc came from the SDK section. We have to ensure it’s SDK agnostic based on it’s new IA location.

item.title: Create an OIDC app integration
item.description: Create an OIDC app integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: The north star is to have a basic “create an OIDC app integration” guide here with generic gaps for the info given by guides that link to it - client org, redirect URLs etc.

item.title: Create a SAML app integration
item.description: Create a SAML app integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: The north star is to have a basic “create a SAML app integration” guide here with generic gaps for the info given by guides that link to it - client org, redirect URLs etc.

item.title: Create an API services app integration
item.description: Create an API services app integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: The north star is to have a basic “create an API Services app integration” guide here with generic gaps for the info given by guides that link to it - client org, redirect URLs etc.

item.title: Run the sample apps
item.description: Run the sample apps Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: The goal of this article is to have the reader run a sample app with each type of redirect model. The base document is https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/oie-embedded-common-run-samples/ which contains instructions for sign-in widget and embedded sdk samples.

item.title: Try a quickstart
item.description: Try a quickstart Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: IA defined in a separate document Target personas: WIC App Developer, Experienced IAM developer Description: A number of quickstart guides have been proposed here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1P8Jt4kvVCC9zAeDsgd18RYXymuNqnHjJLvcy2VtLuis/edit#heading=h.7xq7dm2x4vk6 However, it is still up for debate whether we will include them in due course. Quickstarts were heavily discussed when Okta was moving to CIC. But now that we are in WIC, I don’t think they make as much sense, considering the workforce focus.
